TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DesignerTransaction extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable
Public MustInherit Class DesignerTransaction Implements IDisposable
public ref class DesignerTransaction abstract : IDisposable

summary.span: 提供一种方法来对一系列的设计时操作进行分组，从而提高性能并能撤销大多数类型的更改。

span.span: Provides a way to group a series of design-time actions to improve performance and enable most types of changes to be undone.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事务可以跟踪更高版本可用于撤消的操作。Transactions can track actions that can be undone later. 可以通过取消一个事务，这会自动尝试通过将每个已更改的属性设置为其更改前的值反向每次更改颠倒在事务期间所做的更改。Changes made during a transaction can be reversed by canceling a transaction, which automatically attempts to reverse each change by setting each changed property to its pre-change value. 通过在事务完成后才能推迟到显示的更新，事务还可提高一系列操作期间的性能。Transactions can also improve performance during a series of operations by deferring updates to the display until the completion of the transaction. 事务时，将推迟某些组件，其处理，直到事务完成侦听和事件。When a transaction is in progress, some components defer their processing until the transaction has completed by listening to the and events. 属性窗口中，例如，不会更新其显示后前该事务已关闭，事务已打开。The Properties window, for example, does not update its display after a transaction has opened until the transaction has closed. 若要使用可逆或多个操作的事务，可让设计器创建为每个操作或系列应当可以撤消的操作。To use transactions for reversible or multiple operations, have your designer create a for each operation or series of operations which should be reversible. 请注意不要执行可能会导致无法成功完成一系列撤消事件在事务外的操作。Be careful not to perform actions outside the transactions that might prevent a sequence of undo events from completing successfully. 你可以获取一个新通过调用方法。You can obtain a new by calling the method of an . 请务必获得每个从活动才能正确集成与处理机制，而不是创建一个新的设计器事务直接。Be sure to obtain each from the active in order to correctly integrate with the designer transaction processing mechanism, rather than creating a new directly. 若要执行的操作在事务中，必须先创建一个事务。To perform an action within a transaction, you must first create a transaction. 然后必须调用方法之前发生每个更改或变更集的与方法在每个更改或变更集的发生。Then you must call the method before each change or set of changes occurs, and the method after each change or set of changes occur. 最后，完成并通过调用关闭事务方法。Finally, complete and close the transaction by calling the method. > [!NOTE] > 更改属性值时，使用方法，从而调用的组件更改方法并创建自动表示更改。When making changes to property values, use the method of a , which calls the component change methods of the and creates a representing the change automatically. 若要执行事务，请完成以下步骤：To perform a transaction, complete the following steps: 1. 调用获取可以用于控制事务。Call to obtain a that can be used to control the transaction. 2. 内`try`块中的，您想要与跟踪每个操作，调用方法，请更改或更改，然后调用方法用信号通知是否已进行的更改。Within a `try` block, for each action that you want to track with a , call the method, make the change or changes, then call the method to signal that the change or changes have been made. 3. 若要完成事务，调用中`finally`块。To complete the transaction, call from within a `finally` block. 在 C# 中，你可以使用`using`语句而不是`try/finally`块，如如以下示例所示。In C#, you can use the `using` statement rather than a `try/finally` block, such as in the following example. ``` using (host.CreateTransaction() { // Insert your code here. } ``` 若要取消，并尝试回滚的事务，提交之前，请调用方法。To cancel and attempt to roll back a transaction before it has been committed, call the method. 当调用方法时，操作跟踪反转，以尝试回滚所做的更改。When the method is invoked, the actions tracked by the are reversed to attempt to roll back the changes. 若要撤消作为更早版本的事务的一部分发生的操作，必须使用撤消命令提供的开发环境。To undo actions that occurred as part of earlier transactions, you must use the undo command provided by the development environment. ## Examples 下面的代码示例程序演示如何创建从设计器。The following code example program demonstrates how to create a from a designer. 若要运行此示例，请将源代码编译到类库。To run this sample, compile the source code into a class library. 你必须添加对 System.Design 程序集的引用。You must add a reference to the System.Design assembly. 在新项目中，添加到已编译的 DLL 的引用，并将该组件添加到库中**工具箱**。In a new project, add a reference to the compiled DLL and add the component in the library to the **Toolbox**. 没有对 Visual Studio 中的此功能提供广泛支持。There is extensive support for this feature in Visual Studio. 另请参阅[演练： 自定义组件具有的工具箱中自动填充](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fw694kde\(v=vs.110\).aspx)。Also see [Walkthrough: Automatically Populating the Toolbox with Custom Components](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fw694kde\(v=vs.110\).aspx). 设计器可以选择显示有关设计器事务事件通知。The designer can optionally display notifications about designer transaction events. 如果你添加的实例`DTComponent`到窗体中设计模式中，一个消息框出现，询问是否想要接收设计器事务事件通知。If you add an instance of the `DTComponent` to a form while in design mode, a message box appears asking whether you would like to receive designer transaction event notifications. 您可能切换使用的快捷菜单中右键单击的实例时，将显示这些通知`DTComponent`。You may toggle these notifications using the shortcut menu that appears when you right-click an instance of the `DTComponent`. 使用属性窗口更改值时，将创建事务。Transactions are created when you change values using the Properties window. 你还可以通过单击执行事务的设计器**执行示例事务**组件的快捷菜单上。You can also have the designer perform a transaction by clicking **Perform Example Transaction** on the shortcut menu for the component. [!code-cpp[DesignerTransaction Sample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DesignerTransaction Sample/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[DesignerTransaction Sample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DesignerTransaction Sample/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DesignerTransaction Sample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DesignerTransaction Sample/VB/source.vb#1)]

span.span: if the transaction was canceled; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当取消了设计器的事务时，事务处理机制会尝试回滚已在事务中到目前为止进行的更改。When a designer transaction is canceled, the transaction processing mechanism attempts to roll back the changes that have been made so far in the transaction. 其他操作妨碍了任何相关的代码的状态，以及是否有一系列预期操作未能完成，则它成功与否依赖于为类型的每个操作中，此类因素。Whether this succeeds is dependent upon such factors as the type of each operation, whether other operations interfered with any of the involved code's state, and whether a sequence of expected operations failed to complete.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Commit() cil managed

span.span: Commits this transaction.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 设计器的事务提交后，事务将被视为完成，并且不会跟踪进一步更改。When a designer transaction is committed, the transaction is considered complete and does not track further changes. 事务提交后，进一步调用此方法不执行任何操作。Once a transaction has been committed, further calls to this method do nothing. 始终在创建事务以确保事务正常关闭后调用此方法。Always call this method after creating a transaction to ensure that the transaction closes properly.

span.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.span: 释放由 占用的非托管资源，还可以另外再释放托管资源。

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法称为由公共`Dispose()`方法和方法。This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the method. `Dispose()` 调用受保护`Dispose(Boolean)`方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用`Dispose`与`disposing`设置为`false`。 invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 `Dispose()` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

span.span: for full access to system resources.

Associated state:

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 重写 时，请注意不要引用在以前调用 时已释放的对象。

span.span: When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

para.span: 有关详细信息和，请参阅[清洗向上非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[重写 Finalize 方法](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3)。

span.span: For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Finalize() cil managed

summary.span: 释放与此对象关联的资源。

span.span: Releases the resources associated with this object.

summary.span: 如果此事务尚未提交，则此重写方法将提交此事务。

span.span: This override commits this transaction if it was not already committed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将替代并清理资源通过调用`Dispose(false)`。This method overrides and cleans up resources by calling `Dispose(false)`. 重写 `Dispose(Boolean)` 以自定义清理。Override `Dispose(Boolean)` to customize the cleanup. 应用程序代码不应调用此方法。对象的`Finalize`方法过程中将自动调用垃圾回收，除非已通过调用禁用垃圾回收器的终止方法。Application code should not call this method; an object's `Finalize` method is automatically invoked during garbage collection, unless finalization by the garbage collector has been disabled by a call to the method. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Finalize 方法和析构函数](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fd376774-1643-499b-869e-9546a3aeea70)，[清洗向上非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)，和[重写 Finalize 方法](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3)。For more information, see [Finalize Methods and Destructors](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fd376774-1643-499b-869e-9546a3aeea70), [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md), and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当取消了设计器的事务时，事务处理机制会尝试回滚已在事务中到目前为止进行的更改。When a designer transaction is canceled, the transaction processing mechanism attempts to roll back the changes that have been made so far in the transaction. 其他操作妨碍了任何相关的代码的状态，以及是否有一系列预期操作未能完成，则它成功与否依赖于为类型的每个操作中，此类因素。Whether this succeeds is dependent upon such factors as the type of each operation, whether other operations interfered with any of the involved code's state, and whether a sequence of expected operations failed to complete.
